alert.note: Alert for Borden; Howard; Mitchell; Scurry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 3:57PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Mitchell, southwestern Scurry, southeastern Borden and Howard Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 356 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Coahoma, or 15 miles northeast of Big Spring, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Spring, Coahoma, Forsan, Sand Springs, Colorado City Airport, J B Thomas Reservoir, Luther, Lake Colorado City, Westbrook, Vincent, Cuthbert, Knapp, Buford, Big Spring Country Club, Big Spring McMahon-Wrinkle Airpark, Knott, Ira and Elbow. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 172 and 214. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
